p: Rosin-maleimidopolycarboxylic acids are white/yellowy or gray/brown powders. They can be prepared from maleopimaric acid with aspartic or 4-aminobenzoic acid, or rosin with 1,1â€²-(methylenedi-4,1-phenylene)bismaleimide, according to Scheme 23, before separation via such methods as precipitation, filtration, washing, drying and recrystallization [ 94, 185]. They have a potential to replace petroleum-based epoxy curing agents [ 94, 185]. Furthermore, rosin-maleimidodicarboxylic acid can be used for synthesis of rosin-based chain extender for polyurethanes [ 186], or epoxy resins [ 84].
